org.apache.flink.streaming.api.windowing.policy

Interface EvictionPolicy<DATA>

  • Type Parameters:
    DATA - the type of the data handled by this policy
    All Superinterfaces:
    Serializable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ActiveEvictionPolicy<DATA>, CloneableEvictionPolicy<DATA>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ActiveCloneableEvictionPolicyWrapper, ActiveEvictionPolicyWrapper, CountEvictionPolicy, DeltaPolicy, PunctuationPolicy, TimeEvictionPolicy, TumblingEvictionPolicy

    public interface EvictionPolicy<DATA>
extends Serializable
    An eviction policy specifies under which condition data points should be deleted from the buffer. Deletions must be done only in the order the elements arrived. Therefore, the policy only returns the number of elements to evict on each element arrival.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int notifyEviction(DATA datapoint, boolean triggered, int bufferSize)
      Proves if and how many elements should be deleted from the element buffer.

    • Method Detail

      • notifyEviction

        int notifyEviction(DATA datapoint,
                 boolean triggered,
                 int bufferSize)
        Proves if and how many elements should be deleted from the element buffer. The eviction takes place after the trigger and after the call to the UDF but before the adding of the new data point.
        Parameters:
        datapoint - data point the data point which arrived
        triggered - Information whether the UDF was triggered or not
        bufferSize - The current size of the element buffer at the invokable
        Returns:
        The number of elements to be deleted from the buffer
